careerBank.description: Develops, tests, and maintains software applications and systems to meet user needs.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A typical day involves writing code, collaborating with team members on features, debugging issues, and attending stand-up meetings to discuss progress.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Suitable for late students (taster projects), grads and pros (upskilling/advanced roles).

careerBank.description: Provides and coordinates patient care, educates patients and the public about various health conditions.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A day can include assessing patients' conditions, administering medications, recording observations in medical records, and collaborating with doctors.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Good early-career clinical roles and longer-career progression.

careerBank.description: Analyzes complex data to extract meaningful insights and help organizations make data-driven decisions.
careerBank.educationPath: Master's or PhD in Data Science or related field
careerBank.dayInTheLife: Work involves collecting and cleaning large datasets, building predictive models, and presenting findings to stakeholders through reports and visualizations.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Mostly for grads and pros; students can view as long-term target.

careerBank.description: Creates visual concepts, using computer software or by hand, to communicate ideas that inspire, inform, and captivate consumers.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A day includes brainstorming with clients, sketching out ideas, using design software to create visuals, and revising work based on feedback.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Portfolios matter; good for students (internships) and pros (freelance/lead roles).

careerBank.description: Designs, develops, builds, and tests mechanical and thermal sensors and devices, including tools, engines, and machines.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: Activities often include developing and testing prototypes, analyzing data, creating technical drawings, and managing projects.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Strong fit for students who enjoy hands-on builds and grads entering engineering roles.

careerBank.description: Educates students in a specific subject at the secondary level, preparing them for college and future careers.
careerBank.educationPath: Bachelor's in Education and Teaching License
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A day consists of delivering lessons, grading assignments, communicating with parents, and providing extra help to students.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Students see teaching as a career path; grads/ pros for career-switch.

careerBank.description: Examines, analyzes, and interprets accounting records to prepare financial statements, give advice, or audit and evaluate statements prepared by others.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: Daily tasks include reconciling bank statements, preparing tax returns, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Primarily for grads & pros; students may explore entry-level internships.

careerBank.description: Plans and oversees marketing campaigns to promote a company's brand, products, or services.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A typical day involves analyzing market trends, managing a marketing team, setting budgets, and collaborating with sales and product teams.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Good advanced career for graduates and professionals.

careerBank.description: Installs, maintains, and repairs electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures. Ensures that work is in accordance with relevant codes.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A day can involve installing wiring in new buildings, troubleshooting electrical problems, or repairing outdated systems.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Vocational route â€” great for students looking for early earning.

careerBank.description: Oversees the daily food preparation at restaurants and other places where food is served. Directs kitchen staff and handles any food-related concerns.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A day in the life of a chef includes planning menus, managing kitchen staff, ordering supplies, and ensuring food quality and presentation.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Strong vocational path with apprenticeship options.

student.question: Which of these activities sounds most interesting to you?

Building things.message: Careers in Technology or Engineering may suit you.

Helping people.message: Roles in Healthcare or Education could be a good fit.

Analyzing data.message: Consider careers that emphasise numbers and logic.

Creating art.message: Explore creative roles such as graphic design or media.

student.question: What kind of school projects excite you most?

Science fair builds.message: You might enjoy hands-on engineering or research tracks.

Group presentations.message: Communication and teamwork strengths â€” consider business or education.

Art exhibitions.message: Creative arts paths like design or media could fit well.

Code or apps.message: Tech-oriented paths (software, game dev) could be fulfilling.

student.question: How soon do you want to start earning while learning?

Immediately (part-time).message: Consider vocational/trade certificates or part-time roles.

After finishing school.message: Explore internship and entry-level programs post-graduation.

I prefer full-time study.message: Look at UG degree programs and scholarship opportunities.

Iâ€™m not sure.message: Try exploratory quizzes and short taster courses to decide.

student.question: Which subject at school do you enjoy most?

Maths.message: Math skills open doors to engineering, finance, and data.

Biology / Science.message: Biology fits careers in healthcare, lab science, and research.

English / Languages.message: Strong language skills help in communication, law, and media.

Art / Design.message: Consider visual arts, product design, or media production.

student.question: Do you prefer structured guidance or self-directed learning?

Structured (timetables, teachers).message: You may thrive in formal study programs and degree paths.

Self-directed (online, projects).message: Bootcamps and portfolio-driven careers could suit you.

Mix of both.message: Look for blended programmes, internships, and apprenticeships.

Not sure.message: Start with short courses/club projects to discover what works.

graduate.question: What's your immediate goal after graduation?

Get a full-time job.message: Focus on resume polish, placement drives and graduate roles.

Pursue further studies.message: Look into PG programs, funding, and SOP/CV preparation.

Intern / apprenticeship.message: Internships can be a gateway to full-time roles.

Start a business.message: Explore entrepreneurship programs and startup incubators.

graduate.question: Which skill would you most like to improve before job hunting?

Coding / Technical.message: Consider coding bootcamps and project-based portfolios.

Communication / Public speaking.message: Join presentation clubs, internship interviews and workshops.

Data analysis.message: Short data courses and portfolio projects will help.

Project management.message: Certifications and internships that expose you to workflows help.

graduate.question: What kind of employer do you prefer?

Large corporate.message: Structured graduate programs and stability are common here.

Fast-paced startup.message: Expect diverse tasks and fast learning; portfolio & initiative matter.

followUpResources.title: Joining a Startup: What to Expect

NGO / Public sector.message: Roles may value domain knowledge and mission alignment.

Small-to-medium business.message: Multitasking roles and broader exposureâ€”great for rapid skill building.

graduate.question: How do you prefer to apply for opportunities?

Campus placements.message: Prepare for aptitude tests, company-specific interviews and CV shortlisting.

Direct company applications.message: Tailored CVs and cover letters work best for direct applications.

Referral / network.message: Networking can significantly increase interview chances.

Freelance platforms.message: Build a strong profile and portfolio for short-term gigs.

graduate.question: Which project work do you prefer for your portfolio?

Long-term research.message: Suitable if you aim for research or PG study.

Team product builds.message: Great for product/engineering rolesâ€”shows collaboration and delivery.

Creative showcases.message: A portfolio of finished creative work helps land design/media roles.

professional.question: Why are you considering a career change now?

Growth & promotion.message: Focus on upskilling, certification and internal mobility strategies.

Better work-life balance.message: Explore roles with flexible policies or remote-friendly companies.

Higher pay.message: Map skills to market demand and negotiate with evidence of impact.

To follow passion.message: Plan a staged transitionâ€”side projects, part-time training and networking.

professional.question: Which skill would add the most value to your CV right now?

Advanced data skills / ML.message: High ROI for data-heavy roles; consider certification + projects.

Product management.message: Great for moving toward cross-functional leadership roles.

Cloud / DevOps.message: Cloud certifications paired with deployments boost technical leadership hires.

Leadership & people management.message: Leadership training and documented impact enable manager-level moves.

Immediate (1â€“3 months).message: Target internal moves or roles that value transferrable skills; expect faster interviews.

Short-term (3â€“6 months).message: Use focused certifications and networking to change roles.

Medium (6â€“12 months).message: Plan for certifications plus a portfolio of transition projects.

Long-term (12+ months).message: A full career pivotâ€”consider formal education or deep reskilling.

professional.question: Which outcome is most important when negotiating a new role?

Higher base salary.message: Benchmark market salaries and prepare a negotiation script with evidence.

Better title / seniority.message: Titles matter for future mobilityâ€”align responsibilities with requested title.

Flexible hours / remote.message: Negotiate clear policies and outputs/OKRs to secure flexibility.

Clear career growth path.message: Ask for milestones and promotion timelines; capture them in writing if possible.

professional.question: Which evidence best demonstrates your readiness for a higher role?

Quantified impact (metrics).message: Numbers are persuasiveâ€”collect KPIs and measurable outcomes.

Led a cross-functional project.message: Cross-functional leadership indicates readiness for product/ops leadership.

Built a product/feature end-to-end.message: Product delivery experience supports senior product and engineering roles.

Managed & grown a team.message: Direct people management experience is crucial for management positions.
